er, mount -o remount,rw /: : EXT3-fs: Unrecognized mount option "erro" or missing value..
what is the command like you used exactly?
: the one you just typed in here.. mount -o remount,rw /
: what do you mean? fschk.ext3.
it is how you check your filesystem for errors
: WARNING: bad format on line 10 of /etc/fstab
: ok, I've not done that..
make sure / is mounted RO and then run that (there are switches for a more thorough check, but start with the basic).  If there is a filesystem error it may prevent mounting RW.
: the problem is my /etc/fstab..
: line 9 and 10 in /etc/fstab should be together.. :)
: I cut'n'paste into /etc/fstab .. and forgot to fix the cut lines
ahh.
: but I can't edit /etc/fstab.. because of / ro .. :)
so don't use fstab, sudo mount -o remount,rw /dev/sda1 /
replacing /dev/sda1 with your proper partition ofcourse
: ok, that worked
soundjuicer is installed by default
you could also just use soundjuicer which is already installed and won't pull in 50mb of dependencies.
: hehe yeah, that was what I thought about.. thought konqueror was some huge insane cd-audio ripping util.. but it's a damn file util.. :)
just go to soundjuicer preferences and select "CD Quality, Lossless" for output format.
